snippet: Iraqi officials said that they would fight the Islamic State on their own timetable with or without American help, and U.S. warplanes sat out the biggest Iraqi counteroffensive yet.
abstract: Iraqi officials say they will fight Islamic State on their own schedule regardless of American aid, exposing tensions between two countries; United States warplanes do not participate in largest Iraqi counteroffensive to repel ISIS from Tikrit; Americans express unease with Iranian involvement in operation.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Eric Schmitt from Washington, and Falih Hassan, Ahmed Saleh and Omar Al-Jawoshy from Baghdad.

lead_paragraph: Iraqi officials said that they would fight the Islamic State on their own timetable with or without American help, and U.S. warplanes sat out the biggest Iraqi counteroffensive yet.

headline.main: Iraqi Campaign to Drive ISIS From Tikrit Reveals Tensions With U.S.
headline.print_headline: Iraqi Drive Against ISIS Reveals Tensions With U.S.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
